work.name: PhD Candidate
work.summary: Worked on global localization in unstructured environments from aerial and ground viewpoints, leveraged segmentation and language modeling for mapping and localization in open-set settings, incorporated uncertainty in multiagent trajectory planning. Currently developing a hierarchical SLAM system leveraging Gaussian Splatting for scene understanding.

work.name: Research Assistant
work.position: MIT Space, Technology, Astronomy and Radiation Laboratory
work.summary: Led mechanical design, assembly, and integration of BeaverCube2 3U CubeSat, an Earth-observing nanosatellite equipped with onboard AI for task planning, segmenting, and characterizing satellite imagery with machine learning to optimize downlink decisions.

work.name: Research Assistant
work.summary: Modeled and designed feedback control system for suspension of a novel magnetically-levitated reaction sphere for satellite attitude control.

work.name: Research Assistant
work.summary: Redesigned the mechanical engineering lab course, MECE E3018, at Columbia University to promote active learning.

work.name: Stanford Undergraduate Research Fellowship (SURF) Scholar
work.summary: Predicted plasma flow in spacecraft propulsion systems using extended Kalman filtering.

work.name: NSF Research Experience for Undergraduates
work.position: Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute Brown Research Group
work.summary: Designed an indirect detection technique for weakly interacting massive particle dark matter.
highlights: Advised by Ethan Brown and Morgan Schaller

work.name: NSF Research Experience for Undergraduates
work.position: Boise State University Magnetic Materials Laboratory
work.summary: Designed using SolidWorks and machined biomechanical micropumps, including characterization tests and a user interface to control flow rate.

work.name: Independent Study
work.position: College of Idaho Star Formation Research Lab
work.summary: Visually classified Yellowballs to refine their radius measurements and performed statistical analysis of regression.

work.name: Independent Study and Field Work
work.summary: Collected and analyzed exoplanet data, performed spectroscopy, operated telescopes, and imaged the M33 galaxy.
highlights: Advised by Joe Daglen and Jim Dull

work.name: Research Laboratory Technician
work.position: University of Idaho Research and Extension
work.summary: Developed diagnostic techniques for plant pathogens, wrote grant proposals, designed independent research projects, wrote standard operating procedures.

volunteer.summary: Leading a team of 12 students to perform surface mapping, autonomous robotic operation, localization, orientation, path planning, and object detection on the Lunar surface using IPEx.
Supporting students with their communication skills in the AeroAstro department.
Serving as a Graduate Residential Assistant to support MIT's Housing and Residential Services.
Led integration of multi-agent robotics and AI into architecture for autonomous operations in the Lunar Mars Analog project.
Contributed as a volunteer for various MIT Graduate Student Council activities.

volunteer.organization: MIT Graduate Association of Mechanical Engineers
volunteer.summary: Volunteered to support initiatives of the MIT Graduate Association of Mechanical Engineers.
Reviewed articles for the IEEE Robotics and Automation Letters (RA-L).

volunteer.organization: IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA)
volunteer.summary: Reviewed submissions for the IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA).
Served as an invited panelist for MIT's Mechanical Engineering Graduate Seminar.
Participated as an invited panelist at the MIT Beaver Works Summer Institute.

education.institution: Columbia University in the City of New York

awards.title: Best in Theme, Long Duration Mars Simulation at the Moon
awards.summary: Awarded for the best theme in the NASA RASC-AL competition, focused on long-duration Mars simulation at the Moon.

awards.title: Finalist, Best Paper in Safety, Security and Rescue Robotics
awards.summary: Finalist for the best paper on Safety, Security, and Rescue Robotics at the International Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems (IROS).

awards.title: GRFP Fellowship
awards.summary: Awarded the prestigious NSF Graduate Research Fellowship for academic excellence and research potential.

awards.title: GRA of the Month
awards.awarder: MIT Fraternities, Sororities and Independent Living Groups
awards.summary: Recognized as the Graduate Resident Advisor of the month for contributions to MIT's student living community.

awards.title: Martin Fellowship for Design
awards.summary: Received the Martin Fellowship for excellence in design at MIT.

awards.title: Brookfield Fellowship
awards.summary: Awarded the Brookfield Fellowship for outstanding academic performance and research at MIT.

awards.title: Distinguished Tutor
awards.summary: Recognized as a distinguished tutor by Columbia University's Tutoring and Learning Center.

awards.title: John K. Mladinov Scholarship
awards.summary: Received the John K. Mladinov Scholarship for academic excellence at Columbia University.

awards.title: U.S. Bank Academic All-Conference Award
awards.summary: Recognized as a U.S. Bank Academic All-Conference student-athlete for maintaining high academic standards.

awards.title: Math and Physical Sciences Department Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded for excellence in math and physical sciences by the College of Idaho.

awards.title: Presidential Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded the Presidential Merit Scholarship for academic achievement at the College of Idaho.

awards.title: Gipson Honors Program
awards.summary: Selected for the Gipson Honors Program at the College of Idaho, recognizing academic excellence and leadership.

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
